intro: Gnaphalium ensifer, commonly known as the silverleaf cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats, such as marshes and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium ensifer is often found in the northern United States and southern Canada.
